title: Practice Exercise
description:
Build a **Number Search and Statistics Program** that processes a list of numbers with the following features: - Search for a specific number and stop when found (break) - Skip negative numbers when calculating average (continue) - Use loop else to report if number wasn't found **Requirements:** - Ask user for a number to search for - Loop through the list: [23, -5, 42, 17, -3, 8, 56, 12, -9, 34] - If the number is found, print its position and stop searching - While searching, skip negative numbers when calculating the average - If not found, print a "not found" message - Display the average of positive numbers **Example output (searching for 42):** 
=== Number Search and Statistics ===

Enter a number to search for: 42

Searching...
Skipping negative: -5
Found 42 at position 2!

Average of positive numbers encountered: 32.5
(Processed: 23, 42)
**Example output (searching for 99):** 
Enter a number to search for: 99

Searching...
Skipping negative: -5
Skipping negative: -3
Skipping negative: -9
99 not found in the list.

Average of positive numbers: 27.42
(Processed all: 23, 42, 17, 8, 56, 12, 34)

hints.text: For skipping negatives, check if num < 0 and use continue. For finding the target, check if num == target and use break. The else clause after the for loop will automatically run only if break was never executed. Use enumerate(numbers) to get both position and value.
